verses.verse: PSALM 57Prayer for Rescue from Persecutors.For the music director; set toAl-tashheth. A Mikhtam of David, when he fled from Saul in the cave. (Lit Do Not Destroy) (Possibly, Epigrammatic Poem; or Atonement Psalm) (1 Sam 22:1; 24:3) Be gracious to me, God, be gracious to me, For my soul takes refuge in You; And in the shadow of Your wings I will take refuge Until destruction passes by.
I will cry to God Most High, To God who accomplishes all things for me.
He will send from heaven and save me; He rebukes the one who (Or snaps at) tramples upon me. Selah God will send His (Or faithfulness) favor and His truth.
My soul is among lions; I must lie among those who devour, Among sons of mankind whose teeth are spears and arrows, And their tongue is a sharp sword.
Be exalted above the heavens, God; May Your glory be above all the earth.
They have prepared a net for my steps; My soul is bowed down; They dug a pit before me; They themselves have fallen into the midst of it. Selah
My heart is steadfast, God, my heart is steadfast; I will sing, yes, I will sing praises!
Awake, my glory! Awake, harp and lyre! I will awaken the dawn.
I will praise You, Lord, among the peoples; I will sing praises to You among the (Lit peoples) nations.
For Your goodness is great to the heavens And Your (Or faithfulness) truth to the clouds.
Be exalted above the heavens, God; May Your glory be above all the earth.
